meanings.sent1: She had to redefine the word after learning its new meaning.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to redefine the term in their own words.
meanings.sent3: Trying to redefine 'dog' as a type of fruit just confused everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her unique perspective helped her redefine the concept of success.
meanings.sent5: The artist's bold strokes seemed to redefine the very essence of the painting.

meanings.definition: To give a new or different meaning to.
meanings.sent1: The author wanted to redefine the word to fit her story better.
meanings.sent2: In the debate, each side tried to redefine the issue to their advantage.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to redefine 'rain' as a type of music made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The new technology has the power to redefine how we communicate.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected twist in the plot completely redefined the movie for the audience.
